FuncDef: The display mpls ldp troubleshooting command displays device information when an LDP session is disconnected on a device.
Examples: 1          2018-10-23 07:10:15        The LDP peer 1.1.1.1 went down because the K
epalive time expired. Please check the peer
reachability and run the display tcp status
command to check the TCP status.(CpuUsage=22%,
PingResult is 5 packets success and 0 packets
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If an LDP session on a device is disconnected, run the display mpls ldp troubleshooting command to check the device information for troubleshooting.
